intro: Akeesia africana, commonly known as the African akeesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often with a slightly hairy surface. Akeesia africana is often found in coastal and sandy habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
